result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Restitution is set at 0.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Watson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Watson in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jeremy Watson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to count 2:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 16 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jeremy Watson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, count 1 is ordered dismissed and read in on motion of the state.
AS to count 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing is adjourned to 10-19-2015 at 8:15.  State objects to modification of no contact order.  Court will modify to NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER WITH CHILDREN with 3rd party.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jeremy Watson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Court ordered all motions filed 21 DAYS from today's date. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:16 am.

Defendant Jeremy Watson in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin  
Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant had requested this date to request modification of the no contact order.  Current no contact order stands, per the Court. The Court grants defendant's request for time to hire an attorney.  Court orders case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 38 on 8-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Gabriella O., J.W or J.W., no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  The Court informs defendant that he must appear with counsel on the next court date.  mld
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gabriella C., Jeremiah W. and Josiah W. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Jeremy Watson in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a bail bond hearing in Branch 04.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/23/15 @ 1:30 pm
